title: Bug 102516 - JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand
description: Bug 102516 - JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand The JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query has a tree control that lists the tables and columns in your data source. Currently, when the data set editor is opened, you have to wait while the entire schema is queried, and eventually get the message 'Only 500 items can be viewed in the available list...'. Bug 101372 asks for the ability to filter based on schema.
OB: When the data set editor is opened, the entire schema is queried, causing a delay. Eventually, a message is displayed indicating that only 500 items can be viewed in the available list.
EB: When the data set editor is opened, the tables and columns should load on demand, eliminating the need to query the entire schema upfront. The message indicating the limit of 500 items should not be shown.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query.
2. Observe that the entire schema is queried upon opening the editor.

To verify the expected behavior:
1. Open the JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query.
2. Tables and columns should load on demand without querying the entire schema.
3. The message indicating the limit of 500 items should not be displayed.
